ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Memory
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Orientation
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating  Problem Solving
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Community Affairs
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Home Hobby
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Personal Care
Notes: 0 and 0.5 = None; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Sum of Boxes Score
Dementia Rating (CDR) Global score
Notes: 0.0 = No Impairment; 0.5 = Questionable impairment; 1.0 = Mild impairment; 2.0 = Moderate impairment; 3.0 = Severe Impairment

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Activities Outside Home
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Toileting Personal Hygiene
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Behavior Personality Changes
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Language Communication Abilities
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Mood Changes
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Dementia Rating Attention Concentration
Notes: 0 = None; 0.5 = Questionable; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe

ElementDescription: Does the subject have a problem with memory and/ or thinking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Does the subject have a problem with memory and/ or thinking? Is this a consistent problem?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Does the subject have a problem with memory and/ or thinking? Is this a consistent problem? What was the onset of the problem like?
Notes: 1= Sudden; 2= Gradual; 9= Unknown; 8= NA

ElementDescription: Does the subject have a problem with memory and/ or thinking? Is this a consistent problem? What was the onset of the problem like? Since onset, how have the problems changed?
Notes: 1= Worse; 2= Better; 3= Stable; 9= Unknown; 8= NA

ElementDescription: Does the subject have a problem with memory and/ or thinking? Is this a consistent problem? What was the onset of the problem like? Since onset, how have the problems changed? If worse, progression has been:
Notes: 1= Rapid; 2= Steady; 3= Stepwise; 4= Variable; 8= NA

ElementDescription: Can they recall recent events?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Can they remember a short list of items (shopping list)?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Repeat questions/ statements
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Misplace items
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Forget events and/ or conversations
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Forget to complete tasks
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Have trouble finding words
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Shopping list: Have trouble concentrating or paying attention
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Has there been some decline in memory during the past year?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Is their memory impaired to such a degree that it would have interfered with his/ her activities of daily life a few years ago (or pre-retirement activities)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Do they completely forget a major event (e.g., trip, party, family wedding) within a few weeks of the event?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Do they forget pertinent details of the major event?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Do they completely forget important information of the distant past (e.g., birth date, wedding date, place of employment)?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Tell me about some recent event in his/ her life that he/ she should remember. Within 1 week:
Tell me about some recent event in his/ her life that he/ she should remember. Within 1 month:
What was his/ her main occupation/ job? (or spouse's job if subject was not employed outside the home)
What was his/ her last major job (or spouse's job if subject was not employed)?
When did he/ she (or spouse) retire?
Why did he/ she (or spouse) retire?
How often does the subject know of the exact: Date of the Month

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: How often does the subject know of the exact: Can the subject find his/ her way about familiar streets?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Solve problems at the present time?
Notes: 1= No loss; 2= Some loss; 3= Severe loss; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Cope with small sums of money (e.g., make change, leave a small tip)?
Notes: 1= No loss; 2= Some loss; 3= Severe loss; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Handle complicated financial or business transactions (e.g., balance check-book, pay bills)?
Notes: 1= No loss; 2= Some loss; 3= Severe loss; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Handle a household emergency (e.g., plumbing leak, small fire)?
Notes: 1= As well as before; 2= Worse than before because of trouble thinking; 3= Worse than before (another reason)

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Handle a household emergency (e.g., plumbing leak, small fire)? Worse than before, specify reason.
In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Can the subject understand situations or explanations?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: In general, how would you rate the subject's abilities to: Does the subject behave appropriately (i.e., in his/ her usual, premorbid manner) in social situations and interactions with other people?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Are you working now
Notes: 1=Yes; 2=No

ElementDescription: Did memory or thinking problems contribute to the subject's decision to retire?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 8= NA

ElementDescription: Does the subject have significant difficulty in his/ her job because of problems with memory or thinking?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 8= NA; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Did the subject ever drive a car?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Does the subject drive a car now?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Does the subject drive a car now? If no, is it because of memory or thinking problems?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: If the subject is still driving, are there problems or risks because of poor thinking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has the subject experienced any of the following - Accidents
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has the subject experienced any of the following - Tickets
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, has the subject experienced any of the following - Getting Lost
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Is the subject able to independently shop for their needs?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Is the subject able to independently carry out activities outside the home?
Notes: 1= Usually; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or Never; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Is the subject taken to social functions outside of a family home?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Is the subject taken to social functions outside of a family home? If no, why not?
Woulda casual observer of the subject's behavior think the subject was ill?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: If in nursing home, does the subject participate well in social functions (thinking)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: What changes have occurred in his/ her abilities to perform household chores?
What can he/she still do well?
What changes have occurred in his/ her abilities to perform hobbies?
What can he/ she still do well?
If in nursing home, what can he/ she no longer do well (H and H)?
Ability to perform household tasks
Notes: 0= No loss; 1= Severe Loss

ElementDescription: Ability to perform household tasks - please describe ability
Is the subject able to perform household chores at the level of (Informant does not need to be asked directly)
Notes: 0= Normal function in usual activities; 1= Functions in usual activities but not at usual level; 2= Functions independently in some activities (operates appliances, e.g., vacuum cleaner; prepares simple meals); 3= Functions in limited activities only (with some supervision, washes dishes with acceptable cleanliness; sets table); 4= No meaningful function (performs simple activities, such as making a bed, only with much supervision)

ElementDescription: What is your estimate of subject's mental ability in the following areas: Dressing (Blessed)
Notes: 0= Unaided; 1= Occasionally misplaced buttons, etc.; 2= Wrong sequence, commonly forgotten items; 3= Unable to dress

ElementDescription: What is your estimate of subject's mental ability in the following areas: Washing, grooming
Notes: 0= Unaided; 1= Needs prompting; 2= Sometimes needs help; 3= Always or nearly always needs help

ElementDescription: What is your estimate of subject's mental ability in the following areas: Eating habits
Notes: 0= Cleanly; proper utensils; 1= Messily; spoon; 2= Simple solids; 3= Has to be fed completely

ElementDescription: What is your estimate of subject's mental ability in the following areas: Sphincter control (Blessed)
Notes: 0= Normal, complete control; 1= Occasionaly wets bed / clothes; 2= Frequently wets bed / clothes; 3= Doubly incontinent

ElementDescription: Do you have problems with memory or thinking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: A few moments ago your (study partner) told me a few recent experiences you had. Will you tell me something about those? Within 1 week
Notes: 0= Largely Incorrect; 1= Largely Correct

ElementDescription: A few moments ago your (study partner) told me a few recent experiences you had. Will you tell me something about those? Within 1 month
Notes: 0= Largely Incorrect; 1= Largely Correct

ElementDescription: I will give you a name and address to remember for a few minutes. Repeat this name and address after me: (Repeat until the phrase is correctly repeated or to a maximum of three trials). Max number of elements repeated

I will give you a name and address to remember for a few minutes. Repeat this name and address after me: (Repeat until the phrase is correctly repeated or to a maximum of three trials). Number of trials required
Repeat the name and address I asked you to remember: Number of elements recalled
What is today's date?
Notes: 0=Incorrect; 1=Correct

ElementDescription: What day of the week is it?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: What is the month?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: What is the year?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: What is the name of this hospital (clinic, place)?
Notes: 0=Incorrect; 1=Correct

ElementDescription: What town or city are we in?
Notes: 0=Incorrect; 1=Correct

ElementDescription: What time is it?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: Does the subject know who the informant is (in your judgment)?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: How are these things alike? turnip.....cauliflower
Notes: 0= vegetables; 1= edible foods, living things, can be cooked, etc.; 2= answers not pertinent; differences; buy them

ElementDescription: How are these things alike? desk.....bookcase
Notes: 0= furniture, office furniture; both hold books; 1= wooden, legs; 2= not pertinent, differences

ElementDescription: What is the difference between these things?  lie.....mistake
Notes: 0= one deliberate, one unintentional; 1= one bad the other good - or explains only one; 2= anything else, similarities

ElementDescription: What is the difference between these things?  river.....canal
Notes: 0= natural - artificial; 1= anything else

ElementDescription: How many nickels in a dollar?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: How many quarters in $6.75?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: Subtract 3 from 20 and keep subtracting 3 from each new number?
Notes: 0= Incorrect; 1= Correct

ElementDescription: Upon arriving in a strange city, how would you locate a friend that you wished to see?
Notes: 0= try the telephone book, go to the courthouse for a directory; call a mutual friend; 1= call the police, call operator (usually will not give address); 2= no clear response

ElementDescription: Subject's assessment of disability and station in life and understanding of why she/ she is present at the examination (may have covered, but rate here)
Notes: 1= Good Insight; 2= Partial Insight; 3= Little Insight

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have any other problems related to toileting such as soiling themselves (outside a diaper) or relieving themselves somewhere besides the toilet (such as closet or trashcan)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have any verbally aggressive behaviors such as yelling, shouting, or being argumentative?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have any physically aggressive behaviors such as hitting, kicking, pushing, pinching, biting or throwing things?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have any memory-related symptoms, such as asking the same question repeatedly, losing or misplacing things, trying to cover up memory problems or arguing about forgetting something?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have beliefs that you know are not true? Such as INSISTING people are trying to harm him/her or steal from him/her, INSISTING family members are not who they say they are or that the house is not their home?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have hallucinations such as seeing false visions or hearing imaginary voices? Seeing, hearing or experiencing things that are not present?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Seem sad or depressed? Such as becoming tearful or commenting about feeling worthless or being a burden?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Was your relative in an unfamiliar or new environment today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Seem too cheerful or too happy for no reason? Such as being in an abnormally good mood or finding humor where others did not?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Seem apathetic or indifferent? Such as seeming to have lost interest in the world around him/her or in doing things? Or seeming more difficult to engage in conversation or doing chores?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Seem to act impulsively without thinking, such as doing or saying things in public they normally wouldn't, or doing or saying things that were embarrassing to you, such as using racial slurs or talking to strangers like they know them?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Say crude things or make sexual remarks, or take liberties touching or hugging people in a way that is out of character?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Get easily irritated or disturbed or seem to have moods that rapidly changed? Such as episodes of ''flying off the handle'' or having sudden flashes of anger?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Have any repetitive or compulsive behaviors such as hiding or saving objects, repetitively tapping, or banging, opening and reopening drawers, INSISTING windows be shut or a light be turned on, or NEEDING items be arranged a certain way?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Pace around the house without apparent purpose or wander aimlessly?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Make repeated noises such as groaning, howling, yelling or any other incoherent repeated sound or strange noises? (We are not referring to repeatedly saying a word or phrase.)
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you leave your relative alone for any period of time even though you thought someone should be there to supervise or help them?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you do a pleasant non-care activity with your relative with dementia? Such as doing something together you both enjoy?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative participate in a social activity with other people outside the home?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative participate in a social activity with other people inside the home (such as visitors or talking on the phone)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Struggle, resist or refuse to wash, bathe or shower?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative exercise or do physically active tasks such as walking the dog?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative take naps?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative watch TV?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative do something to make sure you felt appreciated or loved?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you do something to make sure your relative felt appreciated or loved?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative help with household chores, large or small?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative have difficulty or struggle completing a routine task they normally do most days?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative have difficulty or struggle completing any other sort of task because it appeared too challenging for them?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Was your relative somewhere that was excessively loud today? Such as a busy store or movie theater?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Was there a disruption or change in your relative's normal daily routine today, regardless of whether it was positive or negative?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Struggle, resist or refuse to get dressed or change clothes?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Was your relative in an unfamiliar or new environment today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you ''lose your cool'' or become upset with your relative today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you skip care or not help with oral care (such as brushing teeth or dentures) even though your relative needed help?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you skip care or not help with going to the bathroom even though your relative needed help?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you skip care or not help with other personal hygiene tasks such as getting dressed even though your relative needed help?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you skip care or not help at a mealtime even though your relative needed help? Such as encouraging your relative to eat or helping your relative use a fork.
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you ignore reasonable requests for help from your relative?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you ignore unreasonable requests for help from your relative?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you feel like yelling, screaming at or threatening your relative today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did you feel like pushing, shoving, or hitting your relative or doing something else that could hurt?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning, did YOUR RELATIVE do any of the following: Struggle, resist or refuse to use the toilet or let you change their diaper?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Morning (Waking-12:00PM Noon); 2 = Afternoon (12:01PM-5:00PM); 3 = Evening (5:01PM-Bedtime); 4 = Overnight (Bedtime-This morning)

ElementDescription: From yesterday morning until this morning: Did your relative participate in decisions about their life today, such as what to wear or what to eat?
